original: bsgom par ma byas /🔽rnam par bsgom par ma byas /
analyzed: bsgom par ma byas / rnam par bsgom par ma byas /

original: gnyis su ma byas pa'i ye shes mi gnyis pa gnyis po thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i ye shes mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i ye shes rtog pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang /

analyzed: sna tshogs su gyur pa med pa'i ye shes sna tshogs thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / rnam pa tha dad @251a *//

original: par gyur pa med pa'i ye shes rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / 'jig rten du gyur pa med pa'i ye shes 'jig rten thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su phyin pa med pa'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: par gyur pa med pa'i ye shes rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / 'jig rten du gyur pa med pa'i ye shes 'jig rten thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su phyin pa med pa'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: He knows the wisdom that is not a world system.

original: dus su gyur pa med pa'i ye shes dus thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / sems can gyi sar gyur pa med pa'i ye shes sems can gyi khams thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon par chags pa'i spyod yul gyi mthar thug pa dang /
analyzed: dus su gyur pa med pa'i ye shes dus thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / sems can gyi sar gyur pa med pa'i ye shes sems can gyi khams thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon par chags pa'i spyod yul gyi mthar thug pa dang /
translated: the wisdom that knows all times without there being any time that has occurred, the wisdom that knows the realms of sentient beings without there being any realm of sentient beings, the wisdom that is the ultimate object of the domain of attachment that is superior to all higher perceptions,

original: gnas med pa la gzhol ba'i ye shes gnas thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ye shes kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mi zad pa'i mthar phyin pa'i ye shes zad pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: gnas med pa la gzhol ba'i ye shes gnas thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i ye shes kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang / mi zad pa'i mthar phyin pa'i ye shes zad pa thams cad rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: the wisdom that knows all abodes without there being any abode to which it goes, the wisdom that knows all afflictions without there being any affliction, the wisdom that knows all cessations without there being any cessation,

original: chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus yongs su ston pa dang / brjod pa dang / tshig dang / sgra dang / dbyangs dang bral ba'i ye shes sgra dbyangs brjod du med pa rab tu brjod pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba'i ye shes 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus yongs su ston pa dang / brjod pa dang / tshig dang / sgra dang / dbyangs dang bral ba'i ye shes sgra dbyangs brjod du med pa rab tu brjod pa dang /
translated: the wisdom that is directed toward the realm of phenomena and manifests bodies in all world systems, the wisdom that is free from speech, words, sounds, and tones and expresses the inexpressible sounds and tones,🔽the wisdom that is of a single nature and realizes the absence of nature, and the wisdom that engages in a single domain and manifests different domains.

original: rang bzhin gcig pa'i ye shes rang bzhin med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / spyod yul gcig la zhugs pa'i ye shes spyod yul tha dad pa yongs su ston pas brjod pa chen @251b po'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa'i ye shes rang bzhin med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / spyod yul gcig la zhugs pa'i ye shes spyod yul tha dad pa yongs su ston pas brjod pa chen @251b po'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir /

original: sangs rgyas skye ba tshad med pa @256b dang; grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / mtha' yas pa dang / mu med pa dang /🔽sa mtshams med pa dang / brjod du med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas skye ba tshad med pa @256b dang; grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / mtha' yas pa dang / mu med pa dang / sa mtshams med pa dang / brjod du med pa la 'jug go /
translated: They enter into the immeasurable, countless, inconceivable, incomparable, unfathomable, infinite, limitless, boundless, and inexpressible births of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas skye ba grangs dang bgrang ba las 'das pa la 'jug cing shes par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas skye ba grangs dang bgrang ba las 'das pa la 'jug cing shes par byed do //
translated: They enter into and understand the births of the buddhas that are beyond number and enumeration.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yang khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yang khong du chud par byed do //
translated: They comprehend the circles of followers of those buddha bhagavāns.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / chos bstan pa dang / sems can gdul ba dang / sku tshe'i tshad dang; byin gyi rlabs dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i rim pa la yang 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang / chos bstan pa dang / sems can gdul ba dang / sku tshe'i tshad dang; byin gyi rlabs dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i rim pa la yang 'jug go /
translated: They enter into the assemblies of bodhisattvas, the saṅghas of śrāvakas, the teachings of the Dharma, the training of beings, the lengths of their lives, their blessings, and the stages of the duration of their teachings.

original: bskal pa gcig la ji ltar zhugs pa de bzhin du bskal pa thams cad la yang 'jug na /
analyzed: bskal pa gcig la ji ltar zhugs pa de bzhin du bskal pa thams cad la yang 'jug na /
translated: Just as he enters into one eon, so he enters into all eons.

original: sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas ma byung ba'i bskal pa lta ci smos te /🔽bskal pa gang la sems can gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sems can gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa dang / sems can gang gis ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas mthong bar dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas ma byung ba'i bskal pa lta ci smos te / bskal pa gang la sems can gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / sems can gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa dang / sems can gang gis ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas mthong bar dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang /
translated: What need is there to speak of eons without buddhas, eons without a buddha’s appearance?

original: byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rab tu shes te /
translated: The bodhisattva knows those sentient beings who have planted the roots of virtue for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in a certain eon, those sentient beings who have ripened the roots of virtue, and those sentient beings who have ripened the roots of virtue for seeing the future buddhas.

original: de ltar 'jug pas brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal pa la 'jug cing rtog kyang /🔽sngon gyi bskal pa'i dus @257a *//
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pas brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal pa la 'jug cing rtog kyang / sngon gyi bskal pa'i dus @257a *//
translated: The bodhisattva enters into and comprehends inexpressibly inexpressible eons in that way.

original: la 'jug pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: la 'jug pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: But he is not satisfied with entering into the past eons.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu drug pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu drug pa'o //
translated: the sixth is the ocean of the knowledge that enters into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Jinaputra!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa la 'jug cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa la 'jug cing /
translated: Moreover, bodhisattvas enter into future eons,

original: rnam par dpyod la sems shing rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod la sems shing rtog ste /
translated: analyze them, think about them, and contemplate them.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bskal pa gang dang gang ni sangs rgyas dang bcas par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bskal pa gang dang gang ni sangs rgyas dang bcas par 'gyur /
translated: They think, ‘In which future eons will there be buddhas?

original: bskal pa gang dang gang ni sangs rgyas mi bzhugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bskal pa gang dang gang ni sangs rgyas mi bzhugs par 'gyur /
translated: In which eons will there be no buddhas?

original: bskal pa de dag la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni ji snyed cig 'byung /
analyzed: bskal pa de dag la yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni ji snyed cig 'byung /
translated: In those eons how many buddhas will there be?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi mtshan ni ci zhes bya bar 'gyur /🔽'jig rten gyi khams ni gang du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi mtshan ni ci zhes bya bar 'gyur / 'jig rten gyi khams ni gang du /
translated: What will be the names of those tathāgatas?🔽In which world systems?

original: ming ni ci zhes bya ba zhig tu /
analyzed: ming ni ci zhes bya ba zhig tu /
translated: In which world systems?

original: sems can ni ji snyed cig yongs su smin par mdzad par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can ni ji snyed cig yongs su smin par mdzad par 'gyur /
translated: How many beings will they ripen?’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni sku tshe'i tshad ji tsam dang ldan pa zhig tu 'gyur zhes bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu 'brel pa thams cad la rtog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni sku tshe'i tshad ji tsam dang ldan pa zhig tu 'gyur zhes bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu 'brel pa thams cad la rtog ste /
translated: They think, “How long will the lifespans of those thus-gone ones be?”

original: de ltar 'jug cing rtog pas bskal pa brjod du med pa zad par byed kyang /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug cing rtog pas bskal pa brjod du med pa zad par byed kyang /
translated: In this way, they engage and contemplate for inexpressibly long eons, and yet

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus la 'jug pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus la 'jug pas ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: they are not satisfied because they engage with the time that extends to the end of the future.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh aspect, and it shows how their engagement with gnosis in unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood is like the ocean.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Son of the victors!

original: gzhan yang byang @257b chub sems dpa' da ltar byung ba'i dus la 'jug cing rtog ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang @257b chub sems dpa' da ltar byung ba'i dus la 'jug cing rtog ste /
translated: Moreover, bodhisattvas engage with and contemplate the present time.

original: phyogs sna tshogs la 'jug par bya ba dang / phyogs bcu rnam pa gnas pa dang / phyogs kyi rgyud bstan pa mtha' yas pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba dang / phyogs kyi dra ba'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad bstan pa dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs sna tshogs la 'jug par bya ba dang / phyogs bcu rnam pa gnas pa dang / phyogs kyi rgyud bstan pa mtha' yas pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba dang / phyogs kyi dra ba'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad bstan pa dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa dang /
translated: the ten directions, the infinite teachings of the realms of the directions, the nets of the directions, and the different continuums of the nets of the directions.🔽The blessed buddhas have attained, are attaining, and will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / snying po byang chub kyi shing drung du gshegs pa dang / byang chub kyi gzhi la nyug pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / bdud kyi dkrugs ma rab tu pham par mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba dang / snying po byang chub kyi shing drung du gshegs pa dang / byang chub kyi gzhi la nyug pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / bdud kyi dkrugs ma rab tu pham par mdzad pa dang /
translated: They have gone to the foot of the tree of awakening, have touched the seat of awakening, have sat, and have defeated the turmoil of Māra.

original: rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / bzhengs pa dang / grong rdal du gshegs pa dang / lha'i gnas su chos ston pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / sems can gyi khams rnam par 'dul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su ston pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / bzhengs pa dang / grong rdal du gshegs pa dang / lha'i gnas su chos ston pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / sems can gyi khams rnam par 'dul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su ston pa dang /
translated: the attainment of perfect buddhahood, the arising of the Buddha, the Buddha’s entry into the city, the Buddha’s teaching of the Dharma in the divine realms, the turning of the wheel of Dharma, the taming of the realms of sentient beings, the display of the emanations of the tathāgatas,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su gtong ba dang / sku tshe'i 'du byed spong ba dang / phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / chos kyi tshul yang dag par 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su gtong ba dang / sku tshe'i 'du byed spong ba dang / phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / chos kyi tshul yang dag par 'gro ba dang /
translated: the relinquishment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, the Buddha’s renunciation of the composite of his life span, the Buddha’s passing into the parinirvāṇa that has no remainder of the aggregates, the continuation of the way of the Dharma,

original: bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / dam pa'i chos gsal bar byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyis brgyan @258a *//
analyzed: bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / dam pa'i chos gsal bar byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyis brgyan @258a *//
translated: the upholding of the teaching, the illumination of the true Dharma, the adornment of the stūpas of the tathāgatas,

original: par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mchod rten gyi rgyan yid la byed pa dag la sems shing /
analyzed: par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mchod rten gyi rgyan yid la byed pa dag la sems shing /
translated: They make offerings to the stūpas of the tathāgatas, and they mentally create stūpa ornaments in all world systems.

original: rnam par sems la yid la byed de /
analyzed: rnam par sems la yid la byed de /
translated: They think about this, reflect on it, and direct their minds to it.

original: de lta bur 'jug pas sems bskyed pa re re la yang 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa la 'jug cing; sems can thams cad kyang rtogs par byed /
analyzed: de lta bur 'jug pas sems bskyed pa re re la yang 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa la 'jug cing; sems can thams cad kyang rtogs par byed /
translated: By engaging in this way, in each instant of mind they enter inexpressibly many world systems, and they understand all beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mthong bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mthong bar byed /
translated: They see the blessed buddhas.

original: dam pa'i chos kyang thos par byed /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang thos par byed /
translated: They hear the sacred Dharma.

original: thos nas kyang kun chub par byed; dran pas yongs su 'dzin /
analyzed: thos nas kyang kun chub par byed; dran pas yongs su 'dzin /
translated: Having heard it, they master it. They retain it with memory.

original: blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed /
analyzed: blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed /
translated: They discern it with intelligence.

original: rtogs pas rnam par 'phel bar byed de /
analyzed: rtogs pas rnam par 'phel bar byed de /
translated: They increase it with understanding.

original: blos phyogs bcur tshad med par rgyas par byed kyang /
analyzed: blos phyogs bcur tshad med par rgyas par byed kyang /
translated: They expand it boundlessly in the ten directions with their minds.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la mgo rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la mgo rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But they do not become confused about the buddhadharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rmi lam lta bur rnam par bsgoms pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur rnam par bsgoms pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they meditate on everything as being like a dream.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la yang mchod cing rim gror bya ba thams cad byed pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la yang mchod cing rim gror bya ba thams cad byed pas /
translated: They make offerings to those thus-gone ones and serve them in all ways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dang de dag gi zhabs drung du bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro byed par brtson par ston kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dang de dag gi zhabs drung du bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro byed par brtson par ston kyang /
translated: They manifest themselves as striving to make offerings to and serve the thus-gone ones in the presence of those thus-gone ones.

original: bdag gi lus la yang mngon par chags pa med /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la yang mngon par chags pa med /
translated: Yet they are not attached to their own bodies.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la yang ma yin /
translated: They are not attached to the bodies of the thus-gone ones.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams la yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams la yang ma yin /
translated: They are not attached to world systems.

original: chos mnyan pa la yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa la yang ma yin /
translated: They are not attached to listening to the Dharma.

original: @258b bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: @258b bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not attached to engaging with the enumeration of eons.

original: da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas mthong bas ngoms par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas mthong bas ngoms par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: They are not satisfied by seeing the buddhas of the present.

original: chos mnyan pas kyang ma yin /🔽'jig rten gyi khams rnam par brtags pas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: chos mnyan pas kyang ma yin / 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par brtags pas kyang ma yin /
translated: They are not satisfied by listening to the Dharma.🔽They are not satisfied by examining world systems.

original: bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa'i grangs la 'jug pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not satisfied by engaging with the enumeration of eons.

original: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth, the ocean-like wisdom entry into unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro byed /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro byed /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: bkur sti byed /🔽mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: bkur sti byed / mchod pa byed de /
translated: Furthermore, the bodhisattvas serve, venerate, and make offerings to the Bhagavān Buddhas for inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: bskal pa re re la yang brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro byed /🔽bkur sti byed /🔽mchod pa byed cing /
analyzed: bskal pa re re la yang brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro byed / bkur sti byed / mchod pa byed cing /
translated: In each eon, they serve, venerate, and make offerings to inexpressibly inexpressible Bhagavān Buddhas.

original: bdag gi lus skye ba dang / shi 'pho yongs su bstan pas khams gsum thams cad las 'das pa'i mchod pas /
analyzed: bdag gi lus skye ba dang / shi 'pho yongs su bstan pas khams gsum thams cad las 'das pa'i mchod pas /
translated: Through manifesting their own bodies, births, and deaths, they make offerings that transcend the entire three realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba la mchod pa byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi sku gdung la yang bla na med pa'i mchod pas mchod par byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba la mchod pa byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi sku gdung la yang bla na med pa'i mchod pas mchod par byed cing /
translated: They make offerings to the thus-gone ones and their retinues of hearers and bodhisattvas, and they make unsurpassable offerings to the relics of the thus-gone ones who have passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: yongs su gtong ba'i sems bsam gyis mi khyab pas sems can gyi khams thams cad shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rnam par smin pa la re ba med cing phan gdags pa lhur bya ba dang / phan par @259a *//
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba'i sems bsam gyis mi khyab pas sems can gyi khams thams cad shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir / rnam par smin pa la re ba med cing phan gdags pa lhur bya ba dang / phan par @259a *//
translated: With an inconceivable attitude of generosity, they give in order to satisfy the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: 'dod pas yongs su gzung bar sbyin pa byed kyang /
analyzed: 'dod pas yongs su gzung bar sbyin pa byed kyang /
translated: They give without any expectation of karmic ripening, and they do so with a focus on benefiting others and with a wish to help.

original: sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gror bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la yongs su btang ba shin tu btang bas ngoms par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gror bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la yongs su btang ba shin tu btang bas ngoms par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They give with a generosity that is completely open-handed, but they are never satisfied in making offerings to the buddhas and serving them, and in giving to all sentient beings.

original: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gror bya ba dang / sems can nye bar bsgral ba dang / bstan pa yongs su bzung ba dang / dam pa'i chos brjod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems can gdul bas kyang /
analyzed: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gror bya ba dang / sems can nye bar bsgral ba dang / bstan pa yongs su bzung ba dang / dam pa'i chos brjod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems can gdul bas kyang /
translated: They are not satisfied even by serving the blessed buddhas for inexpressibly inexpressible eons, by liberating beings, by upholding the teachings, by proclaiming the sublime Dharma, and by guiding beings to unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth oceanic wisdom of the bodhisattvas, which is called the ocean of wisdom for unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of noble family!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni; byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i man ngag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i nan tan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni; byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i man ngag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i nan tan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas are endowed with the instructions of the bodhisattvas, the trainings of the bodhisattvas, the intimate instructions of the bodhisattvas, the practices of the bodhisattvas, the purity of the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid dang; byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs kyi sgo'i lam sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid dang; byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs kyi sgo'i lam sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang /
translated: the path of the gateway of the form of bodhisattvas,🔽the seeking, the thorough seeking, the taking up, and the understanding of all the bhagavat buddhas,🔽all bodhisattvas, and all dharmabhāṇakas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad @259b dang; chos smra ba thams cad las tshol ba dang / yongs su tshol ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par byed cing sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba dang / bslab pa dang / grub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad @259b dang; chos smra ba thams cad las tshol ba dang / yongs su tshol ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par byed cing sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba dang / bslab pa dang / grub par bya ba dang /
translated: and the gathering of all beings, the training, the accomplishment,

original: sems can de dag la chos bstan pas ngoms par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can de dag la chos bstan pas ngoms par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and the teaching of the Dharma to those beings without satiation,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa /
translated: the generation of the mind that is endowed with omniscience,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul gyi rjes su song bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul gyi rjes su song bas /
translated: and the following of the way of the Dharma of all buddhas,

original: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sems can brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par rab tu gzhog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sbyor yang ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par sems can brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par rab tu gzhog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sbyor yang ngoms par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: They establish inexpressibly inexpressible numbers of sentient beings in irreversible progress toward unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu bcu pa'o //
translated: They are never satisfied with their application to all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po de dag ni /
translated: These are the ten

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ye shes kyis 'jug pa rgya mtsho lta bu ste /
translated: oceanic, vast wisdoms of the bodhisattvas for entering into unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi ye shes chen po rgya mtsho lta bu bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /
analyzed: de dag la gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi ye shes chen po rgya mtsho lta bu bla na med pa 'thob par 'gyur ba dag go /
translated: By relying on them, bodhisattvas will attain the oceanic, vast wisdom of the great qualities of the Buddha.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras; bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras; bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, there are ten of these:🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu ste /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, there are ten kinds of precious conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs @260a *//
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs @260a *//
translated: What are these ten?🔽They are as follows:

original: med par 'gro zhing /
analyzed: med par 'gro zhing /
translated: (1) To go to countless worlds where the buddhas dwell

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams blta ba dang / de dag la phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams blta ba dang / de dag la phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa 'di ni /
translated: and to see the tathagatas, to pay homage to them, and to serve them

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu dang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu dang po'o //
translated: is the first precious conduct of the bodhisattvas toward unexcelled, perfect, and complete awakening.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las chos nyan cing thos nas kyang 'dzin cing khong du chud par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las chos nyan cing thos nas kyang 'dzin cing khong du chud par byed de /
translated: (2) moreover, the bodhisattvas listen to the Dharma from inconceivable buddhas, the bhagavats. Having heard it, they retain it and internalize it.

original: dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed pa dang / rtogs pas rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / blos phyogs bcur tshad med par 'gengs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed pa dang / rtogs pas rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / blos phyogs bcur tshad med par 'gengs pa 'di ni /
translated: It is to be held by mindfulness, to be analyzed by intelligence, to be increased by realization, and to fill the ten directions with the mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu gnyis pa'o //
translated: “O jinaputras! This is the second bodhisattva conduct, which is like a precious jewel, for the complete purification of omniscience.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas kyang mi snang bar ma gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di nas kyang mi snang bar ma gyur la /
translated: “Moreover, O jinaputras, the bodhisattvas do not disappear from this buddha realm,

original: gzhan du yang lus ston la /
analyzed: gzhan du yang lus ston la /
translated: yet they manifest their bodies in other realms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang mgo rmongs pa med pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang mgo rmongs pa med pa 'di ni /
translated: They are not confused about the Dharma of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu gsum pa'o //
translated: “O jinaputras! This is the third bodhisattva conduct, which is like a precious jewel, for the complete purification of omniscience.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos gcig la rnam par spyod pas chos @260b thams cad shes shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos gcig la rnam par spyod pas chos @260b thams cad shes shing /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattvas know all phenomena by engaging in a single phenomenon.

original: chos thams cad don gcig pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mthar thug pa'i tshul gyis chos tha dad pa yang dag par bstan pa yang rab tu shes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad don gcig pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mthar thug pa'i tshul gyis chos tha dad pa yang dag par bstan pa yang rab tu shes pa 'di ni /
translated: They know how to teach the different phenomena in a way that is consistent with the ultimate, which is that all phenomena are of one meaning and not of different meanings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu bzhi pa'o //
translated: This, O jinaputras, is the fourth bodhisattva conduct that is like a precious gem, for the pursuit of unsurpassable, perfect awakening.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “Moreover, O jinaputras,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa yang rab tu shes /🔽nyon mongs pa'i rgyun bcad pa yang rab tu shes /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa yang rab tu shes / nyon mongs pa'i rgyun bcad pa yang rab tu shes /
translated: the bodhisattvas know how to eliminate the afflictions,🔽they know how to cut the stream of the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par gzhil ba yang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par gzhil ba yang rab tu shes te /
translated: and they know how to eliminate the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba la shin tu gnas kyang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba la shin tu gnas kyang /
translated: They are well established in the elimination of the afflictions,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed cing yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog kyang thob la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed cing yang dag pa'i mtha' la yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog kyang thob la /
translated: “Bodhisattvas do not actualize the limit of reality, and yet they attain the highest perfection of the limit of reality.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i bslab pa la shin tu byang bas /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i bslab pa la shin tu byang bas /
translated: They are well trained in the training of skillful means.

original: sngon gyi smon lam yongs su bskang ba'i spyod pa de yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang lus dub par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam yongs su bskang ba'i spyod pa de yongs su rdzogs par byed kyang lus dub par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: They fulfill the conduct that fulfills their former aspirations, and yet their bodies do not become exhausted.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth bodhisattva jewel of the bodhisattvas’ unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'gro ba thams cad sems kyis brtags pa yul na mi gnas pa /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni 'gro ba thams cad sems kyis brtags pa yul na mi gnas pa /
translated: “Moreover, O son of the victors,

original: phyogs na mi gnas par yang shes shing 'jug la /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas par yang shes shing 'jug la /
translated: bodhisattvas know and engage in the fact that all beings are mental imputations that do not exist in a place or a direction.

original: yul dang gnas kyang ston te /🔽rtog pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa @261a *//
analyzed: yul dang gnas kyang ston te / rtog pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa @261a *//
translated: And yet they also teach places and directions.🔽They do not have any concepts or

original: yang med la /
analyzed: yang med la /
translated: formulations.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i phyir mngon par 'du bya ba'i sa la yang spyod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i phyir mngon par 'du bya ba'i sa la yang spyod pa 'di ni /
translated: In order to ripen and guide all sentient beings, they also practice the stage of the formation of the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu drug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth bodhisattva practice, which is like a jewel.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors,🔽furthermore, bodhisattvas know that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature, that they are not various, that they are not of different kinds, that they are not countable, that they are not comparable, that they are not colored, and that they are not characterized.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / sna tshogs ma yin pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa med pa dang / bgrang ba med pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / kha dog med pa dang; mtshan nyid med pas rang bzhin gcig par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / sna tshogs ma yin pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa med pa dang / bgrang ba med pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / kha dog med pa dang; mtshan nyid med pas rang bzhin gcig par rab tu shes te /
translated: They are of a single nature,

original: gcig tu yang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: gcig tu yang mi dmigs la /
translated: and they do not apprehend them as being one.

original: mang po'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: mang po'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa ma yin par rab tu shes te /
translated: They know that they are not of the nature of many.

original: byang chub sems dpas chos 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: Bodhisattvas know that these phenomena are the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos so //
translated: These are the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: These are the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽These are the qualities of the śrāvakas.

original: 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so; ;'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so; ;'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so //
translated: These are the qualities of the ordinary person.

original: 'di dag ni dag pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dag pa'i chos so //
translated: These are pure qualities.

original: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so //🔽'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mi dge ba'i chos so // 'di dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
translated: These are unvirtuous qualities.🔽These are mundane qualities.

original: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: These are supramundane qualities.

original: 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos so //
translated: These are qualities that are reprehensible.

original: 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos so //
translated: These are qualities that are irreproachable.🔽These are qualities that are corruptible.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos @261b so; ;'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos @261b so; ;'di dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos so //
translated: These are qualities that are incorruptible.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos so //
translated: These are conditioned qualities.

original: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa 'di ni /
translated: These are unconditioned qualities.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh jewel-like practice of the bodhisattvas for the accomplishment of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang mi dmigs /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas do not apprehend the blessed buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend the bodhisattvas,

original: chos kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: chos kyang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend the Dharma,

original: sems can yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems can yang mi dmigs te /
translated: and they do not apprehend sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad gdul ba dang / chos thams cad rtogs par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi rgyun kyang mi gcod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad gdul ba dang / chos thams cad rtogs par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi rgyun kyang mi gcod do //
translated: However, in order to guide all sentient beings and realize all phenomena, they do not interrupt the continuity of their aspirations.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O son of the victors!

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems la mkhas pas sems can gzhan gyi rab tu rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dmigs pa la mkhas pas /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems la mkhas pas sems can gzhan gyi rab tu rtog pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dmigs pa la mkhas pas /
translated: It is because the bodhisattvas, through their expertise in the mind, are skilled in the thoughts of other sentient beings and skilled in the objects of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la gdams ngag rjes su ston pa la mkhas pa dang; sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la mkhas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la gdams ngag rjes su ston pa la mkhas pa dang; sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la mkhas pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is skill in teaching all sentient beings the instructions and skill in causing all sentient beings to attain nirvāṇa.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de yang smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de yang smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir spyod pa 'di ni /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings practice this transcendent perfection of wisdom in order to perfect the transcendent perfection of generosity, and in order to perfect the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, the transcendent perfection of tolerance, the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, and the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu brgyad pa'o //🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras /🔽gzhan yang byang chub @262a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam par spyod pa rin po che lta bu brgyad pa'o // kye rgyal ba'i sras / gzhan yang byang chub @262a *//
translated: This, Su­bhūti, is the eighth bodhisattvas’ jewel-like transcendent perfection, by which they transcend the level of the śrāvakas and the level of the pratyekabuddhas and attain the level of the sublime beings.

original: sems dpa' ni 'du shes kyi byin gyi rlabs thams cad la mkhas pas chos rab tu ston cing rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: sems dpa' ni 'du shes kyi byin gyi rlabs thams cad la mkhas pas chos rab tu ston cing rnam par 'byed de /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings teach the sacred doctrine to sentient beings, discerning it with skill in the transformative powers of all perceptions.

original: shes par yang byed la /
analyzed: shes par yang byed la /
translated: They also cause them to understand it.

original: thabs mkhas pas mya ngan las 'das pa yang yongs su ston te /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas mya ngan las 'das pa yang yongs su ston te /
translated: With skill in means, they also reveal nirvāṇa.

original: de yang phyin ci log med pa dang / nor pa med par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log med pa dang / nor pa med par rab tu shes te /
translated: Moreover, they understand this without error or delusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' des de bzhin nyid mi g-yo ba'i phyir /🔽chos thams cad dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des de bzhin nyid mi g-yo ba'i phyir / chos thams cad dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la gnas shing /
translated: Because suchness is immovable,🔽the bodhisattva knows that all phenomena abide in the equality of the three times

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la rab tu rten par yang yang dag par shes te /🔽sems can gang dul ba'am /

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni smon lam chen pos shin tu byung ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'di lta bur rab tu shes pa ni snying rje chen po de bas kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed /

analyzed: yon tan brjod du med pas kyang sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i sems cher bskyed de /

analyzed: de khong du chud par bya'o //

analyzed: thugs rje chen po yang ma glod na bdag cag gis lta sems bskyed pa bden pa'i tshig la gnas la mi slu ba /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos kyi rigs thams cad mi gcod pa /

original: smon lam chen pos mngon du byas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don la gdon mi zar sems @266b bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad shin tu bsags pas yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i gnas pa la rab tu gnas pa ye shes zab mos mngon par bsgrubs pa 'gro ba'i tshogs thams cad khong du chud pa dang /

translated: We abide in the accomplishment of profound wisdom, which is the understanding of the entire assembly of beings.

analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su phyin par ma byas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par ma byas te /

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O jinaputras!

original: bcu po de dag ni /

translated: These ten

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i go cha rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed pa ste /

translated: Abiding in them, the bodhisattvas attain the vajra-like wisdom of the great higher knowledge of the tathagatas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /🔽bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras / bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: O son of the victors!

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtsom pa chen po ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rtsom pa chen po ste /
translated: These are the ten great undertakings of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: bcu gang zhe na / 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mchod do //
translated: If you ask what are the ten, they are as follows:🔽The great undertaking of the bodhisattvas is to make the following vow: “I will make offerings to all the buddhas and serve them.”🔽The great undertaking of the bodhisattvas is to make the following vow: “I will reveal the roots of virtue of all the bodhisattvas.”

original: bsnyen @267a *// bkur ro zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bstan par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mchod rten me tog dang /
analyzed: bsnyen @267a *// bkur ro zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bstan par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mchod rten me tog dang /
translated: The great undertaking of the bodhisattvas is to make the following vow: “I will make offerings to all the stupas of the tathagatas who have passed into parinirvana with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, cloths, parasols, banners, flags, banners of victory, music,

translated: They should be adorned with garlands, incense, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags.

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //

original: dam pa'i chos kyang yang dag par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang yang dag par gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: bstan pa yang yongs su bsrung bar bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang /
translated: They should undertake the great task of bringing all beings to maturity in unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.🔽They should undertake the great task of purifying all world systems as unsurpassed and perfect buddhafields.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bla na med pas yongs su dag par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bla na med pas yongs su dag par bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas think as follows:

original: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa 'grangs pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang sems can re re'i don du yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa 'grangs pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang sems can re re'i don du yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: For as many future eons as there are atoms in all the world-realms, I will practice the bodhisattva conduct for the sake of each and every sentient being in each and every world-system.

original: sems can gcig gi don du ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i @267b don du yang snying rje chen po bskyed de /
analyzed: sems can gcig gi don du ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i @267b don du yang snying rje chen po bskyed de /
translated: Just as I would for the sake of a single sentient being, I will arouse great compassion for the sake of all sentient beings without exception.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: I will practice the bodhisattva conduct in order to establish all sentient beings in the enlightenment of buddhahood.🔽I will not arouse even a single thought of weariness for the sake of the qualities of buddhahood.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o zhes sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don du yongs su skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang mi skyed pa'i brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bskal par mchod pa dang /🔽rim gro bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya'o zhes sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don du yongs su skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang mi skyed pa'i brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bskal par mchod pa dang /🔽rim gro bya ste /
translated: I will make a great beginning, and I will make offerings to and serve each and every one of those blessed buddhas for inconceivable eons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la yang mchod pa dang / rim gro bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang thams cad kyi sku gdung la bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par rin po che thams cad kyi gdugs dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la yang mchod pa dang / rim gro bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang thams cad kyi sku gdung la bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab par rin po che thams cad kyi gdugs dang /
translated: Just as it is for one Tathagata, so it is for all Tathagatas.

original: dril bu dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / bdug spos dang / na bza' thams cad kyis mchod pa bya ste /
analyzed: dril bu dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / bdug spos dang / na bza' thams cad kyis mchod pa bya ste /
translated: Having made this great vow, and after the Parinirvana of those Tathagatas, he will make offerings to all their relics for inconceivable eons with all the parasols, bells, banners, flags, incense, and robes of all the precious substances.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing yang mchod rten 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa brjod du med par khyab pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs kyis brgyan pa mang po byas te /

translated: He will make many stupas for each Tathagata, and those stupas will be adorned with images of the Tathagatas and will fill the inexpressibly vast world systems.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: Those images of the Tathagatas will be like this:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa /
translated: The vast world systems.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par khyab pa de lta bu'i rnam pa dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par khyab pa de lta bu'i rnam pa dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: One should be endowed with such a form as pervades the inconceivable.

original: @268a *// sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsnyen bkur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bstan pa yongs su gzung ba dang / dam pa'i chos brjod pa la rgyun gcod cing /
analyzed: @268a *// sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsnyen bkur ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / bstan pa yongs su gzung ba dang / dam pa'i chos brjod pa la rgyun gcod cing /
translated: For the sake of the Buddha's qualities, one should not even give rise to a single thought of abandoning the service of the Blessed Buddhas, the ripening of sentient beings, the upholding of the teachings, and the expression of the true Dharma.

original: gtang ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang bskyed par mi bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang gcig cing mtshungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtang ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang bskyed par mi bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba des kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang gcig cing mtshungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: One should generate the great undertaking, thinking, I will not give rise to a single thought of abandoning the great undertaking and the roots of virtue. And with those roots of virtue, one should attain the stage of Buddhahood that is the same as and equal to all the Tathagatas.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes brtsam pa chen po rtsom pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang /
translated: I will set out on the great journey, thinking, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang dag par bstan cing /
analyzed: cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang dag par bstan cing /
translated: And having fully awakened, I will display the inconceivable emanations and miracles of a buddha in all the infinite world systems.

original: bskal pa brjod du med par chos bstan kyang bdag gi lus la dub par mi 'gyur zhing ngag dang / sems la dub par mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa brjod du med par chos bstan kyang bdag gi lus la dub par mi 'gyur zhing ngag dang / sems la dub par mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: And even though I teach the Dharma for inexpressible eons, my body will not get tired, and my speech and mind will not get tired.

original: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyang ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa chos dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyis brtan pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyang ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa chos dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyis brtan pa /

translated: to cause the understanding of the accomplishment of all phenomena through the perfection of wisdom, and to cause the understanding of the magical emanations that do not contradict the thoughts of sentient beings; to cause the understanding of the magical emanations that are free from the perception of all phenomena, and to cause the understanding of the magical emanations that are free from the perception of many sentient beings;

original: chos thams cad la tshul gcig tu 'jug cing tshul mtha' yas par ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad la brjod du med par 'jug cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad la tshul gcig tu 'jug cing tshul mtha' yas par ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad la brjod du med par 'jug cing /
translated: to cause the magical emanations that engage in a single method with regard to all phenomena, and to cause the magical emanations that reveal an infinite number of methods; to cause the magical emanations that engage in the inexpressibility of all phenomena, and to cause the magical emanations that engage in the expression of all phenomena;

original: sgo brgya stong gi pha rol gyi rgyud du bstan pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad sgo kun nas rgyu ba'i yi ge'i tshul la mkhas par rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad chos kyi sgo gcig dang mi 'gal ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khong du chud par bstan pas bskal pa brjod du med cing mi zad pa rnam par 'phrul ba dang /
analyzed: sgo brgya stong gi pha rol gyi rgyud du bstan pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad sgo kun nas rgyu ba'i yi ge'i tshul la mkhas par rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad chos kyi sgo gcig dang mi 'gal ba la 'jug pa'i tshul khong du chud par bstan pas bskal pa brjod du med cing mi zad pa rnam par 'phrul ba dang /
translated: the display of teaching the way of letters that is skilled in all the doors of all phenomena, the display of teaching the way of entering into all phenomena without contradicting the single door of phenomena for inexpressible and inexhaustible eons,

original: chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'jug pa la sems can mang po gzung ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams @276b cad mtha' dang dbus med par yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin cing mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sgyu ma'i dra ba rnam pa tha dad pa la 'jug pa med pas bskal pa mu med par mi zad par sems can la ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos su 'jug pa la sems can mang po gzung ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams @276b cad mtha' dang dbus med par yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i mthar phyin cing mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sgyu ma'i dra ba rnam pa tha dad pa la 'jug pa med pas bskal pa mu med par mi zad par sems can la ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba ste /
translated: the miracle of guiding many beings to the Buddha’s Dharma; the miracle of teaching that all phenomena are without center or periphery; and the miracle of teaching beings for endless kalpas without exhausting the different kinds of nets of illusions that are without center or periphery, having reached the end of being unattached to any phenomena.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /🔽bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras / bcu po de dag ni /

original: gzhan la yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / zhing thams cad du nam mkha' byin gyi rlob pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / dus gsum thams cad chos kyi sku gcig gis yongs su rgyas par sems can la ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang /

original: lus gcig tu ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par @277a *//

original: bzhag cing lus mtha' yas pa las rnam par ldang ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / lus gcig gis mngon par sangs rgyas shing sems can snyed kyi lus su yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus sems can gcig gi lus su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang /🔽sems can thams cad kyi lus chos kyi skur ston cing /

translated: manifesting the bodies of all beings in a single body,🔽manifesting the bodies of all beings in the body of the Dharma body,

analyzed: chos kyi sku sems can gyi lus su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba ste /

translated: In this way, he manifested the miracle of all the bodhisattvas’ aspirations being blessed as his own aspirations,🔽the miracle of manifesting the complete enlightenment of all the buddhas through the power and strength of the aspiration for complete enlightenment,🔽the miracle of the complete enlightenment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in accordance with the aspirations of beings to be guided,

original: sems can ji ltar smin pa rang rang gi bsam pa de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / bskal pa 'grangs pa mu @277b med pa thams cad du smon lam gyi rgyun mi gcod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang /

original: rnam par shes pa'i lus las gyen du bskyod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i lus las gyen du bskyod de /

original: ye shes kyi lus la'ang mi gnas pa'i smon lam la dbang bsgyur bas lus thams cad yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rang gi lus tshad du gyur bas pha rol gyi tshogs kyi smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi lus la'ang mi gnas pa'i smon lam la dbang bsgyur bas lus thams cad yongs su ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rang gi lus tshad du gyur bas pha rol gyi tshogs kyi smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang /
translated: They are the display of manifesting all bodies through mastery of the power of aspiration that does not dwell in the body of pristine consciousness; the display of fulfilling all the aspirations of the assembly through the body becoming immeasurable;

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam las phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / bskal pa 'grangs pa thams cad byang chub kyi spyod pas rgyas par dgang ba'i smon lam rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang /

original: skra'i sbubs gcig tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i smon lam gyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rgyas par dgang zhing /🔽'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa /

original: chos kyi sprin chen po byung ba las chos bdud rtsi'i char rab tu 'bab cing /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin chen po byung ba las chos bdud rtsi'i char rab tu 'bab cing /

original: rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i glog snang ba dang / yang dag pa de kho na nyid kyi chos kyi 'brug sgra mngon par 'byung bas sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs @278a *//

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la ye brngam pa med pas /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa gsum pa'o //

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pas /

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang zhing 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi lam la yongs su skyo ba med pa'i yid dang ldan te /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul la mngon du bltas la /

analyzed: bdag gi bde ba la chags pa med de /

analyzed: bud med kyi cho ga dang / mtshan ma dang / cha lugs dang / sgyu rtsal thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa /

analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dgos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob /

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'tshang rgya ba skad cig skad cig tu ston pa spyod pa'i rgyun yongs su mi gcod pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob kyang /

analyzed: bstan pa med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma 'dres pa'i chos te /

analyzed: byams pa chen po'i rang bzhin dang / 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho bas bsod nams kyi rang bzhin dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang gcig tu 'dres pas ye shes kyi rang bzhin dang / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad las 'das pas chos kyi rang bzhin dang /
translated: it is the nature of the Dharma because of being the cause of the Dharma of the buddhas;

original: thams cad du sgo yongs su ston pas /
analyzed: thams cad du sgo yongs su ston pas /
translated: and it is the nature of the light of Dharma because of revealing the door everywhere.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su ston pas /🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi rang bzhin dang / nam 'dod pa'i dus su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bas /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su ston pas / rdzu 'phrul gyi rang bzhin dang / nam 'dod pa'i dus su mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bas /
translated: the nature of miracles;

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: and the nature of enlightenment, which is to attain complete buddhahood at any time one wishes.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras bcu po de dag ni /
translated: “O children of the Victorious Ones, these ten

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: are the natures of the bodhisattvas.
